subject: Physical Fitness
title: Central Sensitization
description: A quick, practical guide to Central Sensitization.

hook.text: Sometimes pain persists long after tissues heal. The alarm system itself becomes the problem.

buildup.text: Central sensitization means the nervous system amplifies pain signals. Normal inputs start producing pain.

discovery.text: Touch, movement, or even cold air can trigger pain in sensitized systems. The volume knob gets stuck on loud.

twist.text: This explains chronic pain after injuries that should have healed. The tissue is fine but the nervous system isn't.

climax.text: Graded exposure â€” slowly reintroducing movement â€” retrains the nervous system to stop overreacting.

punchline.text: Chronic pain is often a volume problem, not damage. Retrain the alarm system.

quiz.question: What is central sensitization?
options: The nervous system amplifies pain signals so normal inputs produce pain
A type of muscle soreness after exercise
A surgical technique for nerve repair
